alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 15 at 7:40PM MDT until April 16 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 12 PM to 8 PM SATURDAY FOR ALL WESTERN AND CENTRAL ZONES DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong winds and extremely dry conditions will persist across western and central New Mexico on Saturday which will result in critical fire weather conditions. A cooler and more stable airmass behind a backdoor cold front will help limit critical fire weather conditions across the east on Saturday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT SATURDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...All of the west and central areas from 12 pm to 8 pm MDT. This also includes the northern mountains below significant snow pack. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 with gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 5 and 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands
